content: I'll be squared away as soon as I clean the couch to get the change for a stamp...looks like I owe Uncle Sam four bucks... “If you bring these leaders to trial, it will condemn the North, for by the Constitution, secession is not rebellion...His (Jeff Davis') capture was a mistake. content: I did mine about 2 months ago. I owed a little over $300 bucks. Not too bad. I have been trying to make it dead even (no refund,no owing) for the past 8 years, but I never make the same amount from year to year. So, it is kind of hard. But, this is probably the least I've owed in a while.
reply: I did mine about 2 months ago. I owed a little over $300 bucks. Not too bad. I have been trying to make it dead even (no refund,no owing) for the past 8 years, but I never make the same amount from year to year. So, it is kind of hard. But, this is probably the least I've owed in a while.
title: Well I done and did it - How about you?

content: Got a nice refund. There are few good things about service in Iraq, but one of them is non-taxable combat pay. According to the IRS I only made 4,500. I actually cleared 33,000, if you include Hazardous Fire Pay and Safe Pay and Foreign Language Proficiency Pay. I filed both 2007 and 2008 about a month and a half ago. (I didn't have to file for 07 until I'd been home 90 days.) So, anyway refund is about a month's pay. Which helps, since I still have no job.
